comment: She's initially an art teacher, and it really shows by her not giving a crap about this class. She does nothing to make the class interesting in any way, shape or form. As a Freshman, this was my hardest class due to my sheer disinterest in her and her class.

I dislike this professor A LOT. Her tests were so difficult and the questions were on material that you wouldn't think is important to know. We did useless activities in class that had no connection to what we were learning. Never graded anything on time. I recommend that you stay away from her.

Tests and quizzes are could be hard due to the fact that she asks for specific details. Fortunately, she drops lowest test grade. Sometimes gives busy work which half of us tend to forget to do. Write all the upcoming due dates down! Overall, very good at teaching us about Kennesaw and other ways to be successful.
Same as Lovelace-Habers. Lots of people want to hate on her, but bottom line: do your work, go to class, study for midterm and final, and you make an A. Now how hard was that?

Wow, for a freshman seminar class, she wa horrible. She was very picky on grading our papers, she handed back assignments that we did two months before,and she did not care about your grade. I worked really hard for a C which messed with my HOPE.

Good teacher I liked her but she made the test pretty hard, I had a problem with her tests they were on an overhead and you recorded your answers with a remote that was always tearing up and hardly ever worked. I got an A in the class when I calculated it my grade was a B. I have no clue how she came up with an A but I liked it! :-)

Great teacher!! Nice to talk to and tries to make class interesting. The only problem was the amount of work involved. I must have done 7 papers, 4 projects, a lot of homework assignments and the online portfolio. With all the assignments I still enjoyed the class.

If you want to do a horrible group project with seven other people with completely different schedules, then take her.  And let me remind you, that she is totally unapproachable and doesnt understand that poeple have lives outside of a Required Art Class!  P.S. Make sure you know A LOT about Art before you go into this class, or plan to be lost!
shes is a good teacher. the class was just a bit confusing with all the art history and stuff

Must be interested and have knowledge in art to do well in this class. A very sweet nice person but often forgot she was teaching multiple learning communities, so she talked to the art oriented LC at higher levels. Hard tests! Test reviews are worthless! Lectures are on the boring side. Attendace is a must!

the class was pretty easy.  i'm sure if you read, then you'll do well.  i have the book for sale for anyone who is taking it spring 2006.  trecker@students.kennesaw.edu You can pay me more than the bookstore buyback, and still pay a good bit less.
if you like to stare at pictures and then have to memorize them and be tested, then take this class.  a lot of note taking and lectures and she is so boring.  really hard tests.

I really enjoyed her class!!  She was always very helpful and I leanred so much from her.  She really inspired me to push myself no matter what the assignment required.  I really like her as a person but mostly I thought she was a wonderful teacher.  I would take her class again in a heart beat=:)

She's a good teacher, I guess.  I mean the class I had with her really shouldn't be a class, but whatever.  She's nice and very helpful; she kept us posted with campus events and volunteer activities.  Really there was nothing to her class...she's a great person, though.
She's boring and our first test is over 12 Chapters. She makes things so difficult. Don't take this class with her!!
I was unimpressed with the class, and felt that the professor needs some more practice.  I was hoping to learn a lot more in the class than I did.
Man, Natasha Lovelace is the hottest teacher @ KSU. I have a hard time paying attention in class because she is so damn hot.
Great teacher. she will push you to produce better work. she allows for undividual style and is more than willing to answer questions.

I was a pretty good artist before I took her class, but I found I was able to improve my abilities further with her help.  I can understand some of the other students frustration. If you're not good at art, you won't make an A, but I can say, you will improve no matter what your skill level is.

She has high expectations but is very willing to help you to achieve them. Homework is important in this class & one assignment comes right after the other. She allowed my to use my own style even though at first she didn't understand it. Made lots of suggestions during drawing process and critique.
